identificationModule.briefTitle: The Investigation of Public Awareness of Core Stroke Symptoms
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Investigation of Public Awareness of Core Stroke Symptoms

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To investigate public awareness of core stroke symptoms in more than 40 years old population and its related factors.

primaryOutcomes.description: The awareness rate of core symptoms (FAST: facial droop, arm weakness, speech disturbance, time to call an ambulance)

secondaryOutcomes.description: The associated factors with the stroke recognition/ correct action to stroke
Analysis of stroke recognition rate and correct action rate and their associated factor in subgroups.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* More than 40 years old (born before December 31st 1976) without specific requirements.
* Be able to finish the questionnaire.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participants with disturbance of consciousness.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Participants are more than 40 years old without specific requirements. This study is a population-based screening programme.
